You also get coaching that tailored to you. Getting Started Continue Get In Bed Wake Up Steps Heart Points Activity goals No thanks Turn On Gender Name Weight Height Track Your activities Fit can track walking, running and cycling in the background. This means you get metrics like steps, distance, and calories for all these activities. To do this, the app needs permission to recognize your activity. Over time, Fit also uses this data to personalize your experience, and better recognize activity. If you choose to turn this setting off, you can still manually track workouts with Fit. Allow Don't Allow Set goal Keep moving each day to meet your steps goal and avoid sedentary time steps a day 4500 Heart Points You score Heart Points for doing activities at a higher pace, like taking a brisk walk. Increases the intensity to earn more points. 50 points a day 4500 25 944 Calories burned 2 Km Covered 20 Walking min Get notifications from Fit Allow Fit to send notifications to get coaching messages and tips to help you meet your goals Turn on notifications Your Body Mass Index BMI is a simple calculation used to assess whether a person has a healthy body weight for their height User BMI Sync Fit with Health Connect Share stats between Fit and your other apps, like your calories, heart rate, and body measurements Energy expanded Last 7 days cal Today Your daily goals 0/7
Achieved Your weekly target 0 of 150 Scoring 150 Heart Points a week 
can help you live longer, sleep 
better, and boost your mood
To help you stay on top of all your goals, Fit can now sync with Health Connect to share data with the other apps you use.
 
 This means you can add data to Fit from your other apps and devices, and share your Fit data with them.
How it works 
 
 When you set up Health Connect, you can choose which data you want Fit to read or write. 
 
 When you allow Fit to read data type from Health Connect, it's stored in your Google Account with your other Fit data. Fit uses this data to provide features like tracking your fitness and health, and giving related recommendations and insights.
 
 How Fit uses data also depends on the features you use. For example, Fit may show distance data from Health Connect in workout summaries, or show heart rate data in your sleep sessions. 
 
 Fit also uses this data to personalize or improve products and services. Usage data is collected for troubleshooting and product improvement purposes. 
 
 Data you choose to write to Health Connect is stored on your device, and other apps that you choose to sync with Health Connect will be able to access this data. 

Managing your data 
 
 You can delete data stored in Health Connect, by going to your Fit settings to Health Connect to Manage data and access. 
 
 You can change the data Fit shares with Health Connect, or turn this feature off, from your Fit app settings. Turning off this feature won't delete any data.
